256x256.quote: Progressive image size, start_size=256, final_size=512, size_step=32. Size starts increasing after the warm up stage finishes.

512x512.quote: Progressive image size, start_size=256, final_size=512, size_step=32. Size starts increasing after the warm up stage finishes.

blur.quote: Successful: Horizontal Flip, Vertical Flip, Blur

cutmix.quote: CutMix, MixUp, FMix, 25% probability for each of past three augmentations.

fmix.quote: CutMix, MixUp, FMix, 25% probability for each of past three augmentations.

huesaturationvalue.quote: Successful: Horizontal Flip, Vertical Flip, Blur, 360 rotates, RandomBrigtnessContrast, ShiftScaleRotate, HueSaturationValue

mixup.quote: CutMix, MixUp, FMix, 25% probability for each of past three augmentations.

randombrightnesscontrast.quote: Successful: Horizontal Flip, Vertical Flip, Blur, 360 rotates, RandomBrigtnessContrast

rotate.quote: Successful: Horizontal Flip, Vertical Flip, Blur, 360 rotates

shiftscalerotate.quote: Successful: Horizontal Flip, Vertical Flip, Blur, 360 rotates, RandomBrigtnessContrast, ShiftScaleRotate

tta.quote: We used simple technique for our TTA: average of the default image and horizontally flipped image.

densenet161.quote: Models: SWSL ResNeXt 101 8D, SWSL ResNeXt 50, Efficient Net B4, Efficient Net B4 NS, Inception V4, DenseNet 161

efficientnet-b4.quote: Then we trained Efficient Net B4 with obtained labels and got the CV boost from 0.899 to 0.915. Models: SWSL ResNeXt 101 8D, SWSL ResNeXt 50, Efficient Net B4

efficientnet-b4-ns.quote: Models: SWSL ResNeXt 101 8D, SWSL ResNeXt 50, Efficient Net B4, Efficient Net B4 NS

inception-v4.quote: Models: SWSL ResNeXt 101 8D, SWSL ResNeXt 50, Efficient Net B4, Efficient Net B4 NS, Inception V4

swsl-resnext101-8d.quote: We trained 5 folds of SWSL ResNeXt 101 8D and predicted labels for all images from each validation part

cross-entropy-with-label-smoothing.quote: Loss Function - Cross Entropy loss with label smoothing (0.2 smoothing before using knowledge distillation and 0.1 after it)

cosinebatchdecayscheduler-with-gradual-w.quote: scheduler - CosineBatchDecayScheduler with gradual warm up (custom impelementation)

batch_size.quote: Args: optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer): PyTorch Optimizer, steps (int): total number of steps, epochs (int): total number of epochs, batchsize (int): current training batchsize. Default: 128

gradient-accumulation.quote: Mixed precision training with gradient accumulation (iters_to_accumulate=8) ==> big boost on CV

knowledge-distillation.quote: We did a really soft knowledge distillation. We hadn't time to do a lot of experiments, so we had only one take to relable the dataset... Then we trained Efficient Net B4 with obtained labels and got the CV boost from 0.899 to 0.915.

label-smoothing.quote: Loss Function - Cross Entropy loss with label smoothing (0.2 smoothing before using knowledge distillation and 0.1 after it)

mixed-precision-training.quote: Mixed precision training with gradient accumulation (iters_to_accumulate=8) ==> big boost on CV

pseudo-labeling.quote: This dataset contains images of other plants. The dataset is not fully labeled... So the second part had to be pseudo-labeled to be able to use it for training. We used 5 folds of SWSL ResNeXt 101 8D for this task.

5-fold.quote: We trained 5 folds of SWSL ResNeXt 101 8D... We submitted two different ensemble approaches with the same 6 models (5 folds each one).

2019-data.quote: We used 2019 data with removed duplicates for training. We used it only for training and didn't put it in the validation part. We've also applied soft relabling for it.

mendeley-leaves.quote: We also used Mendeley Leaves for training. This dataset contains images of other plants.

progressive_resizing.quote: Progressive image size, start_size=256, final_size=512, size_step=32. Size starts increasing after the warm up stage finishes.

maxprob-ensemble.quote: 2) MaxProb Ensemble. Max Probability (or Max Confidence) ensemble allows us to choose the dominating model in the prediction process. In this case, if several models predict different labels, we take the prediction from a model with the biggest confidence.

simple-averaging-ensemble.quote: 1) Simple Averaging Ensemble, 2019 Private LB: 0.92712; 2020 Public LB: 0.898; 2020 Private LB: 0.896

apex.quote: Checkpoints for Apex have been added.
